Class MovementComponent

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.components.MovementComponent
public class MovementComponent extends Object
Represents a movement component that controls the velocity and movement of an Actor. This component updates the position of an actor based on its velocity in the X and Y directions.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private double
    velocityX
    The horizontal velocity of the actor.
    private double
    velocityY
    The vertical velocity of the actor.

    getVelocityX()
    Returns the current velocity of the actor along the X-axis.

    getVelocityY()
    Returns the current velocity of the actor along the Y-axis.

    setVelocity(double velocityX, double velocityY)
    Sets the velocity of the actor in both the X and Y directions.

    • velocityX

      private double velocityX
      The horizontal velocity of the actor.

    • velocityY

      private double velocityY
      The vertical velocity of the actor.

  • Constructor Details

    • MovementComponent

      public MovementComponent(double velocityX, double velocityY)
      Constructs a new MovementComponent with the specified velocities.
      Parameters:
      velocityX - the initial velocity along the X-axis.
      velocityY - the initial velocity along the Y-axis.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(Actor actor)
      Updates the position of the specified actor based on the current velocity values. The actor's translation in both the X and Y directions is incremented by the respective velocity values.
      Parameters:
      actor - the actor whose position is updated.

    • setVelocity

      public void setVelocity(double velocityX, double velocityY)
      Sets the velocity of the actor in both the X and Y directions.
      Parameters:
      velocityX - the new velocity along the X-axis.
      velocityY - the new velocity along the Y-axis.

    • getVelocityX

      public double getVelocityX()
      Returns the current velocity of the actor along the X-axis.
      Returns:
      the velocity in the X direction.

    • getVelocityY

      public double getVelocityY()
      Returns the current velocity of the actor along the Y-axis.
      Returns:
      the velocity in the Y direction.
